intro: Corokia macrocarpa, commonly known as the broadleaf kōwhai, is a deciduous shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky resin. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens throughout the country.
